alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 2:43PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Platte and southeastern Converse Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 242 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Douglas, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Platte and southeastern Converse Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 115 and 129. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; North Laramie Range
